intro: Ribes maximoviczii var. saxatile, commonly known as the saxatile gooseberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Grossulariaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically yellow or orange in color, which are used in local cuisines. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
